Xuejiao et al. reported the synthesis of a substituted pyridine based acetamide BTA derivative 30 ( Figure 18) and screened its anti-cancer activity both in vitro and in v ivo. Derivative 30 demonstrated anti-proliferative activities against a wide spectrum of human cell lines and induced the mitochondrial apoptotic pathway in HepaG2 cell lines. The BTA scaffold 30 proved to be a promising candidate for cancer chemotherapy
37 .
